meanings.definition: Lacking style or good taste; tacky or unfashionable.
meanings.sent1: The outfit she wore to the party was the naffest thing I've ever seen.
meanings.sent2: That old lamp in the corner is the naffest piece of furniture in the room.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at dancing was so naffest that it made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The naffest decorations at the event were like a neon sign screaming 'bad taste'.
meanings.sent5: The naffest painting in the gallery stood out like a sore thumb among the masterpieces.

meanings.definition: To be of poor quality or inferior.
meanings.sent1: I hope this new phone doesn't naffest like my last one did.
meanings.sent2: The material used for this toy tends to naffest quickly with rough play.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leak only managed to naffest the situation further.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds threatened to naffest the fragile roof of the shed.
meanings.sent5: The cheap glue began to naffest, causing the model to fall apart.
